meanings.definition: To attract or captivate with charm or enchantment.
meanings.sent1: The magician was able to becharm the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful melody of the song becharmed everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics never failed to becharm the children.
meanings.sent4: The old book seemed to becharm anyone who opened its pages, transporting them to another world.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling stars in the night sky seemed to becharm the young couple on their romantic date.

meanings.definition: To cast a spell over; bewitch.
meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer attempted to becharm the hero with a dark incantation.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious potion had the power to becharm anyone who drank it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy decided to becharm the forest animals for her own amusement.
meanings.sent4: The haunting melody of the song seemed to becharm all who heard it, as if under a magical spell.
meanings.sent5: The ancient amulet was said to becharm its wearer, granting them protection and luck.
